NMF Standalone
  • English Text Processing
  • View page source

English Text Processing

This module provides functions for processing English text, including dictionary creation, preprocessing, and topic analysis.

Dictionary Creation

functions.english.sozluk.sozluk_yarat(veri, alanadi, lemmatize=False)[source]

Creates a vocabulary list from a DataFrame column of text data.

This function processes text data by tokenizing it, applying lemmatization (if enabled), and creating a set of unique tokens. It then converts this set into a sorted list of tokens, which serves as a vocabulary for further text analysis.

Parameters:

  • veri (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame containing the text data.

  • alanadi (str) – The name of the column in the DataFrame that contains the text data.

  • lemmatize (bool, optional) – Whether to apply lemmatization to the text data. Defaults to False.

Returns:

A tuple containing the vocabulary list and the number of documents processed.

Return type:

tuple

Text Preprocessing

functions.english.process.preprocess(metin=None, lemmatize=False, kategoriler=frozenset({}))[source]

Preprocesses text data by applying lemmatization (if enabled) and removing stopwords.

This function performs text normalization, including lowercasing, Unicode normalization, and removing specific character categories. It also removes common English stopwords and applies lemmatization (if enabled).

Parameters:

  • metin (str) – The text data to be preprocessed.

  • lemmatize (bool) – Whether to apply lemmatization to the text data.

  • kategoriler (frozenset) – A set of character categories to be removed.

Returns:

A list of preprocessed words.

Return type:

List[str]

Raises:

ValueError – If the input text is None.

Numerical Conversion

functions.english.sayisallastirma.sayisallastirma(N, sozluk, data, alanadi, lemmatize, tokenizer)[source]

Convert text documents to numerical representation using tokenizer encoding.

Parameters:

  • N – Number parameter (unused in current implementation)

  • sozluk – Dictionary/vocabulary (unused in current implementation)

  • data (DataFrame) – DataFrame containing text data

  • alanadi (str) – Column name containing text data

  • lemmatize (bool) – Whether to apply lemmatization during preprocessing

  • tokenizer – Tokenizer object with encode method

Returns:

List of tokenized document IDs or None on error

Return type:

list or None

Topic Analysis

functions.english.topic_analyze.extract_topics(doc_by_topics, word_by_topics, top_n=10, doc_word_pairs=None, weights=None)[source]

Extract top words and documents for each topic from NMF matrices.

Parameters:

  • doc_by_topics (sp.csr_matrix) – Document-topic matrix (W matrix)

  • word_by_topics (sp.csc_matrix) – Word-topic matrix (H matrix)

  • top_n (int) – Number of top items to extract per topic

  • doc_word_pairs (list[tuple[int, int]]) – Optional word-document pairs

  • weights (list[float]) – Optional weights (unused in current implementation)

Returns:

(topic_words, topic_word_weights, topic_docs, topic_doc_weights)

  • topic_words: List of top word indices for each topic

  • topic_word_weights: List of corresponding word weights

  • topic_docs: List of top document indices for each topic

  • topic_doc_weights: List of corresponding document weights

Return type:

tuple

functions.english.topics.get_topic_names_out(data_frame_name, num_of_topics, sozluk, word_per_topic, topics_db_eng=None, H=None, gen_cloud=False)[source]

Extract topics and their top words from NMF H matrix, optionally generate word clouds and save to database.

Parameters:

  • data_frame_name (str) – Name of the dataset

  • num_of_topics (int) – Number of topics to extract

  • sozluk (List[str]) – List of words in vocabulary

  • word_per_topic (int) – Number of top words to extract per topic

  • topics_db_eng – SQLAlchemy engine for database connection (optional)

  • H – Topic-word matrix from NMF (numpy array or sparse matrix)

  • gen_cloud (bool) – Whether to generate word clouds

Returns:

Dictionary mapping topic names to lists of top words with scores

Return type:

dict
